title: Hound
data:
***Version [0.31](/0.31 "0.31")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

*For a list of all canines, see [list of canines](/List_of_canines "List of canines").*

| hound h [![Hound.png](/images/c/cc/Hound.png)](/File:Hound.png) |                                                                                                                                      |

| [Uses](/Item_usage "Item usage")                                | [Uses nothing](/Category:Uses_nothing "Category:Uses nothing")                                                                       |
| [Holiness](/Holiness "Holiness")                                | [Natural](/Category:Natural_holiness "Category:Natural holiness")                                                                    |

|   |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| - | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | A fearsome hunting dog, lithe and alert. Its master must be long gone, for it looks dishevelled, and has a lean and hungry look.***“A traveller, by the faithful hound, Half-buried in the snow was found, Still grasping in his hand of ice That banner with the strange device, Excelsior!” -Henry Wadsworth Longfellow, “Excelsior” |

## Useful Info

**Hounds** are the second sorts of canines you are likely to encounter. They are fast enemies that are bigger and stronger than [jackals](/Jackal "Jackal"), although they don't travel in packs. They can be found in the early portions of [the Dungeon](/The_Dungeon "The Dungeon").

## Tips & Tricks

- A hound can manage to chew up a fragile caster, but that's only if you let it get close enough to hit you.
- For melee characters, they are moderately tough threats. Not especially difficult, but their speed makes it difficult to retreat. Don't fight (or explore) at low HP if you can at all help it.

## History

- Prior to [0.31](/0.31 "0.31"), players could summon them via [Call Canine Familiar](/Call_Canine_Familiar "Call Canine Familiar").

Hound

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.31: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.

For a list of all canines, see list of canines.

hound h 
HP 10-22
HD 3
XP 42
Speed 15
AC 2
EV 13
Will 10
Attack1 6 (bite: plain)


Resistances None
Vulnerabilities None
Habitat Land
Intelligence Animal
Uses Uses nothing
Holiness Natural
Size Small
Type hound, hound
Flags See invisible
Unblindable
Warm-blooded
A fearsome hunting dog, lithe and alert. Its master must be long gone, for it looks dishevelled, and has a lean and hungry look.

“A traveller, by the faithful hound, Half-buried in the snow was found, Still grasping in his hand of ice That banner with the strange device, Excelsior!”
-Henry Wadsworth Longfellow, “Excelsior”

Useful Info

Hounds are the second sorts of canines you are likely to encounter. They are fast enemies that are bigger and stronger than jackals, although they don't travel in packs. They can be found in the early portions of the Dungeon.

Tips & Tricks

  • A hound can manage to chew up a fragile caster, but that's only if you let it get close enough to hit you.
  • For melee characters, they are moderately tough threats. Not especially difficult, but their speed makes it difficult to retreat. Don't fight (or explore) at low HP if you can at all help it.

History

  • Prior to 0.31, players could summon them via Call Canine Familiar.
